meanings.definition: A flap of cartilage at the root of the tongue that covers the windpipe while swallowing.
meanings.sent1: The epiglottises protect the windpipe when you eat.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the epiglottises to understand how they work.
meanings.sent3: The epiglottises decided to have a party in the throat.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice was like the epiglottises, guarding her windpipe.
meanings.sent5: The epiglottises are like tiny gatekeepers in your throat.

meanings.sent1: I learned that epiglottises means more than one epiglottis.
meanings.sent2: The doctor mentioned epiglottises during the anatomy lesson.
meanings.sent3: The epiglottises in the class formed a choir to sing together.
meanings.sent4: In the forest of throats, the epiglottises stood tall like trees.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained that epiglottises are multiple throat protectors.
